issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I have a Nvidia GPU without cuda, everytime I run the verification scripts it borks in the middle because ARROW_HAVE_CUDA is evaluated to yes because `nvidia-smi --list-gpus` returns true. This can be a long process if I forget about it.

Would it be better to check for `CUDA_HOME`?
fields.summary: Verify release script is over optimist with CUDA detection

comments.body: I think it would be better to be explicit about running with CUDA enabled

Is {{CUDA_HOME}} an environment variable?
If so, it's not suitable because we can use CUDA without defining {{CUDA_HOME}} environment variable.

{{nvidia-smi --list-gpus 2>&1 > /dev/null && nvcc --version 2>&1 > /dev/null}} will be better.
Seems like `nvcc` check is a good middle ground.
